intro: Ruellia euantha, commonly known as the purple roselight, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia euantha thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
